post.author: Enforcer
post.body:
I was noticing this earlier but still cant figure out why

What are the differences btwn

Complete

&

Unlimited

in the maya packages?

nm

Autodesk Maya Complete
Autodesk® Maya® Complete comprehensive 3D software solution is designed especially for producing professional-quality graphics on desktop PCs or graphics workstations. It integrates all of the best tools for 3D modeling, animation, and rendering within a single, production-proven workflow. Maya Complete—the choice of award-winning digital artists and animators—has an intuitive design that makes it a favorite amongst film, broadcast, game development, multimedia (print and web), and design visualization artists of all experience levels.


Autodesk Maya Unlimited
The ultimate version of Maya–Autodesk® Maya® Unlimited software–is the choice of digital artists who are looking to make their 3D projects stand out. Maya Unlimited includes all the functionality found in Maya Complete and provides professional artists and animators with additional industry-leading innovations such as Maya Fluid Effects, Maya Cloth, Maya Hair, Maya Fur, and Maya Live, for the creation of superior digital content.

Ok which version would u buy?

post.author: parsonsbear
post.body:
Well, it depends on what kind of work you're doing. For video game stuff, only cloth and hair directly apply, though fluid effects can make for some nice 2d images for particles.

Maya Live is a tracking/compositing software that's really quite pathetic compared to programs like Boujou and PFTrack.
